title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string should be rejected when entered in the default value field of a DateTime type report parameter in BIRT report designer.
OB: When an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', is entered in the 'default value' field of a DateTime type report parameter in BIRT report designer, the system does not reject the input and instead stores it.
EB: The system should reject invalid date/time strings that do not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format when entered in the 'default value' field of a DateTime type report parameter in BIRT report designer.
SR: To reproduce the issue, perform the following steps: 1. Open the BIRT report designer. 2. Create a new 'DateTime' type report parameter. 3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string that does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format, such as '55/66/9999'.
